articles.title: Kim Jong Il Meets Chinese Defence Minister
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Meets Chinese Defence Minister
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il Wednesday received Col. General Liang Guanglie, minister of National Defence who doubles as a state councilor of the People's Republic of China, and his party on a visit to the DPRK.
					On the occasion the Chinese defence minister courteously conveyed to Kim Jong Il regards of Hu Jintao, General Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, President of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the PRC.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed thanks for this and asked Liang Guanglie to convey his regards to Hu Jintao before having a cordial and friendly talk with Liang. 
					
					 Present there were Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Kang Sok Ju, first vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming, and Military, Naval and Air Attache of the Chinese embassy Sun Yanfeng.

articles.title: Chinese Defence Minister on Sino-DPRK Friendship
articles.content:
Chinese Defence Minister on Sino-DPRK Friendship
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Col. General Liang Guanglie, minister of National Defense who doubles as a state councilor of the People's Republic of China on a visit to the DPRK, when interviewed by mediapersons in Pyongyang Tuesday said that the Sino-DPRK relationship sealed in blood will last forever.
					 He noted that his visit to the DPRK helped him to know well about the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance and working hard displayed by the Korean people in socialist construction under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Consolidating and developing through generations the traditional Sino-DPRK relationship provided by the leaders of the elder generation is the desire of the two peoples, he said, and went on:
					
					 We could feel deep friendship of the Korean people to the Chinese people during our stay in the DPRK.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relationship has steadily grown stronger under the deep care of the leaders of the two countries.
					
					 We extend warm greetings and best wishes to the people and army of the DPRK on behalf of the Chinese people and army.
					
					 We will make positive efforts together with the comrades of the DPRK for the beautiful future of the two countries as well as the regional and global peace and stability.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairman of Russian Federation Council
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chairman of Russian Federation Council
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.
					 Kim said that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Russia have long historical roots, underscoring the need to boost the relations in conformity with the desire of the two peoples.
					
					 Mironov noted that he would strengthen the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in the spirit of the joint declarations agreed upon by the top leaders of the two countries. He hoped that the Korean people would achieve successes in their struggle for opening the gate for a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 Present there were Kim Wan Su, vice-chairman of the SPA, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and officials concerned.
					
					 On hand were Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Aleksei Borodavkin, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, Ruslan Tatarinov, director of the Secretariat of the Federation Council, Andrei Baklanov, director of the Bureau for International Relations of the Federation Council, Konstantin Pulikovski, advisor to the chairman of the Federation Council, and other suite members.

articles.title: Gift from Chairman of Russian Federation Council
articles.content:
Gift from Chairman of Russian Federation Council
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, now on a visit to the DPRK.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, by the chairman on Wednesday.

articles.title: Chairman of Russian Federation Council Feted
articles.content:
Chairman of Russian Federation Council Feted
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Supreme People's Assembly gave a reception in honor of the visiting chairman of the Federation Council of Russia at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday. 
					 Present there on invitation were Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Aleksei Borodavkin, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ruslan Tatarinov, director of the Secretariat of the Federation Council, Andrei Baklanov, director of the Bureau for International Relations of the Federation Council, Konstantin Pulikovski, advisor to the chairman of the Federation Council, and  other suite members and officials of the Russian embassy.
					
					 Present there were Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Wan Su, vice-chairman of the SPA, Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Deputy to the SPA Hong So Hon, chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Parliamentary Group, Kim Song Hui, deputy to the SPA, and other officials concerned.
					
					 Choe Thae Bok said at the reception that this visit would contribute to expanding and developing not only the relations between the two parliaments but also the overall relations between the DPRK and Russia.
					
					 He expressed belief that the DPRK-Russia relations would grow stronger in the spirit of the joint declarations agreed upon by the top leaders of the two countries and the new inter-state treaty.
					
					 Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov said in his speech that the friendly relations between the two countries have deep historical roots, adding that the close cooperation between the two peoples would greatly contribute to ensuring peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia.
					
					 The cooperation between the parliaments of the two countries is conducive to the development of the Russia-DPRK relations, he noted, calling for joint activities in the interests of the peoples.

articles.title: Chairman of Russian Federation Council Visits Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Chairman of Russian Federation Council Visits Liberation Tower
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, laid a wreath before the Liberation Tower on Wednesday.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were the chairman's party and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Officials concerned were on hand.
					
					 The wreath in the name of the chairman's party was laid before the tower.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the fallen fighters of the Soviet Union Army and looked round the tower.

articles.title: Chairman of Russian Federation Council Returns Home
articles.content:
Chairman of Russian Federation Council Returns Home
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, returned home by air Wednesday after visiting the DPRK at the invitation of its Supreme People's Assembly. 
					 Leaving with him were Ruslan Tatarinov, director of the Secretariat of the Federation Council, Andrei Baklanov, director of the Bureau for International Relations of the Federation Council, Konstantin Pulikovski, advisor to the chairman of the Federation Council, and other suite members.
					
					 During their stay in the DPRK the chairman and his party visited Mangyongdae.
					
					 They also visited the Russian Language Center at Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies and the Jongbaek Church.

articles.title: S. Korea Blasted for Hindrance to Resumption of Tourism
articles.content:
S. Korea Blasted for Hindrance to Resumption of Tourism
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee issued a statement Wednesday as regards the lapse of one year and five months since the suspension of tourism of Mt. Kumgang.
					 Recalling that the north side has so far made all possible sincerity and efforts to resume the Mt. Kumgang tourism so as to meet the south Korean people's wish to sightsee this famous mountain of the nation, the statement said:
					
					 However, the authorities of the south side are taking very dishonest attitude, instead of responding to our side's good faith and magnanimity.
					
					 The authorities of south Korea including officials of the "Ministry of Unification" raised the "three preconditions"--probe into the truth behind the "case of a tourist", prevention of recurrence of such case and guarantee of personal safety--for the resumption of tourism, shifting the blame for the suspended tourism on to north side. And they have unhesitatingly made such reckless remarks that they will not resume tourism without getting response to those demands and do not acknowledge the "agreement with civilian businesswoman". 
					
					 Furthermore, they are demanding an "apology" for the said "case" while blaring that they will not allow cash-term tourism even though the "preconditions" are met and that the resumption of tourism of Mt. Kumgang and Kaesong will be possible only under the condition that transparency for the return from tourism is ensured. 
					
					 What amazed us is that such smear campaign for confrontation was joined by the chief executive of south Korea.
					
					 The above-said remarks are sheer sophism reminiscent of a thief crying "Stop the thief!" and a blatant insult and mockery of the DPRK's sincerity and efforts.
					
					 As a matter of fact, it is none other than the south side which gets benefit from Mt. Kumgang tourism.
					
					 It is clearly exemplified by the fact that after the suspension of Mt. Kumgang tourism the Hyundai Asan was put on the verge of bankruptcy and dozens of relevant enterprises suffered a lot, to say nothing of the livelihood of the inhabitants in the area of South Kangwon Province.
					
					 All facts go to clearly prove that the ulterior intention of the south side authorities including the "Ministry of Unification" is not to resume Mt. Kumgang tourism and that they only seek to take an active part in the U.S. farce to apply "sanctions" against the DPRK and thus stoke confrontation with fellow countrymen, regardless of the inter-Korean relations and the fate of businesses of the south side and its people's livelihood.
					
					 The issue of the resumption of the tourism brought into bolder relief their true colors of the present authorities in south Korea as obstructionists of reconciliation and cooperation and die-hard confrontational elements of the nation. 
					
					 It is needless to say that as long as such anti-reunification elements as Hyon In Thaek are allowed to stay in the ministry it is impossible to make smooth progress in the resumption of Mt. Kumgang tourism nor is it possible to improve the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Absolutely intolerable are the ministry's moves to abuse even the noble tourism for inciting confrontation with fellow countrymen. All the Koreans will never pardon Hyon and the ministry.  
					
					 The ministry and the conservative authorities of south Korea should immediately stop ridiculous acts, facing up to the trend of the times.

articles.title: Pomminryon Issues Joint Resolution
articles.content:
Pomminryon Issues Joint Resolution
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) issued a joint resolution in the north and the south of Korea and abroad on Nov. 20 on the occasion of the 19th anniversary of its formation.
					 The resolution noted that Pomminryon has always taken the lead in the reunification movement of the fellow countrymen for defending the three principles of national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity--and the inter-Korean declarations and carrying them into practice.
					
					 It stressed that Pomminryon would further promote the national reconciliation and cooperation and strengthen the solidarity and unity with all the pro-reunification patriotic forces at home and abroad by strictly adhering to and implementing the inter-Korean declarations in order to defend peace of the country and open up a new phase of independent reunification. 
					
					 Pomminryon will also ensure the organic relation and joint action with All-Korean Committee for Implementation of June 15 Joint Declaration and heighten the vigilance against the separatist forces' crafty moves to split and estrange the pro-reunification patriotic forces, it said. 
					
					 The resolution said that the organization would categorically reject all sorts of confrontational concept, including the watchword "no nukes, opening and 3,000 dollars" which denies the inter-Korean declarations, encroaches upon the other party's system and dignity and incites the national confrontation, and decisively check all the joint military exercises and war moves staged with foreign forces. 
					
					 It will fight it out to get such anti-reunification and anti-national evil laws and institutional barriers as the "National Security Law" abrogated, realize the legality of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and ensure the release of the unreasonably arrested pro-reunification patriots, it said.
					
					 The resolution also stressed that Pomminryon would expand itself and further consolidate the solidarity of the north, south and overseas parties.
					
					 Next year is a significant year marking the 10th publication anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration and the 20th birthday of Pomminryon, it noted, saying: Pomminryon will glorify 2010 as a year of shining victory in which its movement is developed and a new epochal turn for the national unity and independent reunification brought under the banner of the inter-Korean joint declarations.

articles.title: DPRK Make Contribution to Ensuring World Food Security
articles.content:
DPRK Make Contribution to Ensuring World Food Security
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government will further boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the FAO and its member countries in the future, too, in the idea of its foreign policy-- independence, peace and friendship-- and make a positive contribution to the worldwide efforts to ensure the world food security.
					The head of a DPRK delegation said this, when addressing the 36th General Assembly of the FAO on November 20.
					
					Humankind's desire to achieve prosperity in a peaceful and equal world is still facing serious challenges, he said, and went on:
					
					The FAO should channel primary efforts into creating an international environment for achieving sustainable agricultural development to weather the food crisis and financial and economic crisis, first of all.
					
					The organization should also pay a due attention to helping its member countries work out agricultural strategies and policies suited to their actual conditions and create a socio-economic environment for bolstering the agricultural productive forces.
					
					The organization should, at the same time, create an atmosphere of ensuring that agricultural products of developing countries find their ways to international markets, unhindered, and take a positive step to ensure that the developed countries unconditionally and sincerely implement the internationally proclaimed aid commitments.
					
					The DPRK government has directed primary efforts to the priority domains of the national economy in the economic construction and, at the same time, focused all efforts on attaining the grain production goal to solve the food shortage by its own efforts, he concluded.

articles.title: DPRK, Bulgaria Cooperate in Health
articles.content:
DPRK, Bulgaria Cooperate in Health
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- An inter-governmental agreement on cooperation in the fields of public health and medical science between the DPRK and Bulgaria was signed in Sofia on Nov. 19.
					 It was inked by the DPRK ambassador to Bulgaria and the minister of Health of Bulgaria.

articles.title: Symposium on Juche-based Idea of Literature and Art Held
articles.content:
Symposium on Juche-based Idea of Literature and Art Held
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- A symposium on the Juche-based idea of literature and art of Korean feature film "A Day of Training" took place Tuesday.
					 At the symposium speakers explained that the film gives correct answer to a question of the times how the army and people should make worthwhile each day of the drive for the building of a thriving nation through the looks of soldiers of the People's Army who are glorifying an ordinary day only with noble loyalty and obligation for Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The film gives vivid ideological and artistic depiction of the fact that the fundamental source of the indefatigable mental power displayed by soldiers in training is their noble spiritual world yearning for and following Kim Jong Il at every footstep with blood ties with him and that one can work miracles and perform feats in any adversity when one has the spirit of devotedly defending the leader and the spirit of devotedly implementing his instructions, they stressed.
					
					 They called upon all the creators and artistes to arm themselves with the Juche-based ideas and theories of the Workers' Party of Korea on literature and art and create more masterpieces replete with the spirit of the times conducive to the development of Juche-based film art.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Off Press
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works" Off Press
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House brought out Vol. 84 of "Complete Collection of Kim Il Sung's Works", a library of the Juche idea which systematically and comprehensively deals with his famous works according to a chronological order.
					The book contains 41 works including historic speeches, conclusions and talks made by President Kim Il Sung from June to December Juche 75 (1986).
					
					 The collection comprehensively deals with the prominent ideas, theories and policies set forth by
						 Kim Il Sung for socialist construction in the DPRK and the accomplishment of the cause of global independence on the basis of a scientific insight into the requirements of the developing revolution in the period of great changes when the government of the DPRK was being consolidated more solidly and the Korean revolution was entering a new stage.
					
					 In his work "For the Complete Victory of Socialism" he comprehensively systematized and further developed the theory on the complete victory of socialism and clarified the issue of waging a dynamic struggle for materializing it and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country. 
					
					 He indicated a guiding principle for putting the national economy on a new high stage and radically improving the standard of people's living in his works including "On Some Issues to Be Held Fast to in Carrying Out the Third Seven-Year Plan for National Economy", "On Stepping Up Rail Transport" and "Let Us Develop the Light Industry to Improve the Standard of People's Living".
					
					 He clarified specific strategic and tactical issues arising in advancing the non-aligned movement and promoting the cause of global independence in his works including "For the Development of the Non-Aligned Movement" and "Talk to a Delegation of the International Union of Students".
					
					 Also clarified in the collection are issues of sprucing up the area of Mt. Paektu well and consolidating the organizations of all levels of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and intensifying their activities.

articles.title: Historic Nanpaizi Meeting
articles.content:
Historic Nanpaizi Meeting 
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Over seven decades have elapsed since a historic meeting was held in Nanpaizi.
					 Grave, indeed, was the situation in the latter half of the 1930s.
					
					 Under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung the anti-Japanese armed struggle and the organizations of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland had been rapidly expanded and the Korean revolution was gaining momentum by the advance of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into the homeland. Scared by this, the Japanese imperialists stepped up large-scale "punitive" operations and repression of the KPRA and the patriotic people.
					
					 The aftermath of the adventurous expedition to Rehe imposed upon from outside made the then difficulties worse.
					
					 To cope with the situation the President convened a meeting of military and political cadres in Nanpaizi, Mengjiang County from November 25 to December 6, Juche 27 (1938).
					
					 At the meeting he made a historic speech titled "Let Us Break the Present Deadlock and Lead a Continuous Advance of the Revolution".
					
					 In the speech he stated that it was important for the Korean communists to hold fast to the independent stand and to correctly evaluate the situation, saying that the units of the KPRA should advance into the border area around Mt. Paektu as soon as possible and invigorate the military and political activities in more vigorous way in wide areas.
					
					 In order to actively organize and wage military and political activities in accordance with a new strategic and tactical policy, the forces of the KPRA should be reorganized in keeping with it, he noted, and designated in detail the theatres and content of operations of the newly-reorganized directional forces and the independent regiments.
					
					 He stressed that in order to successfully carry out the difficult revolutionary tasks raised by the requirement of the situation, all the commanding officers and members of the KPRA should give a full display to the indomitable revolutionary spirit, firmly ensure the unity of the ranks based on the revolutionary comradeship and positively defend the interests of the people. He also underlined that the KPRA and the people should unite as one and fight against the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 After the meeting the President led the main force of the KPRA into the homeland, while taking measures to select best members of the KPRA and send them to some units of the Anti-Japanese Allied Army.
					
					 The historic Nanpaizi Meeting made a great contribution to initiatively bridging over the difficulties of the revolution and to waging more vigorously the overall Korean revolution with the anti-Japanese armed struggle as the centre on a steadfast independent stand.

articles.title: Korean People's Faith and Willpower in Sure Victory
articles.content:
Korean People's Faith and Willpower in Sure Victory
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il made public the famous work "Let Us Open the Road to Fresh Victory with the Revolutionary Faith, Willpower and Courage of President Kim Il Sung" on November 25 seven years ago.
					 It is a monumental work which clarified a key to the victory of the socialist cause.
					
					 Kim Jong Il, in the work, proudly reviews the history of the Korean revolution which has won victory after victory with the revolutionary faith, willpower and courage of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The work expounds in a clear-cut way the iron-logic that the revolution is the faith, willpower and courage and the issues of principle for the entire people of the country to achieve a new victory by entirely following the faith and courage that the President had possessed and the Workers' Party of Korea is carrying forward.
					
					 The past seven years are a proud period during which the Korean people, with faith in the victory of the revolution and willpower, have ushered in a great heyday of national prosperity, frustrating the challenge and pressure of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					The Korean people's faith, willpower and courage are being given to the full extent in the current general onward march of the Songun revolution.
					
					 They, with an absolute trust in Kim Jong Il, are advancing vigorously along the road indicated by him.
					
					 The eternal prosperity of the country and the happiness of the posterity to come hinge on believing and following leader Kim Jong Il. This unshakable willpower is the kernel of the revolutionary faith settled in hearts of the Korean people.
					
					 The high degree of ideological and mental world of the Korean people is manifested in their spirit of defending the revolutionary leadership with their very lives and regarding it as their lifeblood, and in the spirit of thoroughly implementing his instructions with which they are creating everything from nothing and turning impossibility to possibility.
					
					 The Korean people, who firmly believe in the victory of the Korean-style socialism, are invariably holding fast to the steady anti-U.S. and independent stand and thorough-going revolutionary principle with invincible faith, willpower and courage. They regard the national defence as the supreme duty of the citizens and hold high the Songun politics of the WPK.
					
					They will make greater effort to build a great, prosperous and powerful socialist country and accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of Kim Jong Il who is increasing the national strength of the DPRK in every way and is bringing about a great prosperity in the Songun Korea with the revolutionary faith, willpower and courage of the President.

articles.title: KCNA Slams Japan's Talk about "Elimination of Nukes"
articles.content:
KCNA Slams Japan's Talk about "Elimination of Nukes"
 Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed recently that the former government of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan had said one thing and did another as regards the nuclear issue, sparking furor in the international arena. 
					 According to what was disclosed by James Schlesinger, former U.S. secretary of Defense, at a press conference, last year and this year the chief executive of the above-said government expressed concern to the council that in case nuclear disarmament is pushed forward, the trust in the "nuclear umbrella" to be provided by the United States to Japan may sink.
					
					 At that time, he provided even a list of nuclear forces to be maintained by the U.S. including updated nuclear warheads, nuclear submarines and B-52s. 
					
					 This fact goes to prove that the "elimination of nukes" touted by Japan so far is nothing but hypocrisy intended to mislead public opinion at home and abroad. 
					
					 Japan has so far talked a lot about "the elimination of nukes" in the international arena, trumpeting that it is the only "atomic-bombed country" in the world and the like. 
					
					 This being a hard reality, Japan blatantly challenged the nuclear disarmament under the signboard of "elimination of nukes."
					
					 Japan paid lip-service to "the three non-nuclear principles" but behaved quite contrary to them behind the scene. It secretly agreed with the U.S. to overlook the portcall of warships of the U.S. forces carrying nuclear weapons on Japanese ports and their transit through its territorial waters, increasing the nuclear threat to Northeast Asia. 
					
					 Japan has turned the archipelago of Japan into a forward nuclear base of the U.S. under its "nuclear umbrella". Not content with this, it has persistently pushed forward its independent nuclear weaponization. 
					
					 Japan is possessed of the technology for manufacturing nuclear weapons and nuclear fuel and even their delivery means. 
					
					As proven by the above-said facts, Japan's loud-mouthed "elimination of nukes" is nothing but a smoke-screen to hide its despicable record of nuclear-related crimes and accelerate its nuclear weaponization. 
					
					 Japan has posed a nuclear threat to Northeast Asia and steadily escalated it since long ago. Its talk about the nuclear issue is just like a thief crying "Stop the thief!"
					
					 Japan would be well advised to honestly admit its hideous crimes related to nukes before taking issue with somebody's nuclear issue.
					
					It is quite self-evident that it is impossible to denuclearize Northeast Asia and the rest of the world unless Japan opts for true nuclear dismantlement as it is the arch criminal posing a nuclear threat to the region.

articles.title: Warm Love Shown for Bereaved Children
articles.content:
Warm Love Shown for Bereaved Children
Pyongyang, November 25 (KCNA) -- Upon receiving the news that bereaved children of revolutionary martyrs arrived in Pyongyang from various places of east Manchuria, China, the anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk called all of them to her residence on a day of June Juche 37 (1948).
					 She rushed at a breath to the children entering the front gate and embraced them, saying in an emotion-charged tone: Why are you coming now from where and do you know how much effort General Kim Il Sung has made to find out your whereabouts for nearly three years following the liberation? 
					
					 She also asked them in detail how many days were required to come to the motherland, by what they came, whether there were children who felt train-and car-sickness and how many children remained there.
					
					 Reading carefully their faces as if she tried to find features of her beloved fallen comrades-in-arms and gave prepared foodstuffs to every child.
					
					 Seeing a child who was wearing trousers worn out at the knees, she said that she would patch up the torn trousers. A woman official suggested that she would do it.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk said to the following effect: As the comrades-in-arms placed their children under the care of the General, when they were dying on the battlefield, I am their mother now and I must patch it up.
					
					 Her earnest words moved both the bereaved children and the woman official to tears.
					
					 There are so many stories about the love shown by Kim Jong Suk who regarded it as her noble moral obligation to bring up the children of the fallen comrades-in-arms in her care.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige fabricas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno las fabricas y empresas de la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte.
					La Fabrica de Cojinete de Ryangchaek fue el primer destino de su direccion.
					
					Luego de escuchar la explicacion de la modernizacion de la fabrica, el Dirigente se entero detalladamente del estado de promocion de reconstruccion tecnica y produccion recorriendo el taller de elaboracion y otros lugares.
					
					Muy satisfecho de que la clase obrera de la fabrica estuviera reconstruyendo magnificamente su centro de trabajo conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo y registrando incesante auge productivo, aprecio mucho los meritos de ella.
					
					Si se realizan la modernizacion y la cientifizacion basadas en la ciencia y tecnica de punta fomentando de continuo el caracter independiente de la economia nacional como esta fabrica, es posible poner de pleno manifiesto en todos los aspectos la superioridad y la vitalidad de nuestra autarquica economia nacional, senalo.
					
					Continuo que el espiritu revolucionario de lucha y la actitud emprendedora de trabajo de la clase obrera de la fabrica, que avanza e innova de continuo sin estancarse ni por un momento, son el ejemplo que deben seguir todas las unidades.
					
					Destaco que nuestra industria de maquinaria que se desarrolla rapidamente demanda el aumento constante de la produccion de cojinete, uno de los elementos indispensables, y enseno que para resolver con satisfaccion este problema apremiante, se debe elevar decisivamente la calidad de cojinete y desarrollar nuevas variedades de distintas normas.
					
					Indico que para traer un cambio trascendental en la produccion de cojinete, hay que seguir impulsando dinamicamente la modernizacion y la cientifizacion de la fabrica y al mismo tiempo, introducir la ciencia y tecnica de punta y prestar atencion primordial a las labores para elevar el nivel tecnico y la calificacion de los productores.
					
					Acto seguido, el Dirigente visito a la Fabrica de Zapatos de Sinuiju.
					
					Recorrio primero la sala de educacion de la actividad historico-revolucionaria.
					
					Senalo que bajo la sabia direccion del Presidente Kim Il Sung, esta fabrica se ha fortalecido y desarrollado como fidedigna base de produccion de zapatos, que desempena el papel importante para resolver el problema de zapatos de los habitantes.
					
					Subrayo que esta fabrica basta para conocer cuan enormes fueron esfuerzos fisicos y espirituales realizados por el Presidente Kim Il Sung para mejorar las condiciones de vida del pueblo.
					
					Al recorrer el taller de suela y otros procesos de produccion, hizo conocimiento en detalles del estado de equipos tecnicos y produccion.
					
					Se mostro muy complacido de que la clase obrera de la fabrica normalizara en el alto nivel la produccion mediante la modernizacion y la cientifizacion de los procesos de produccion.
					
					Destaco que para producir mucho mas zapatos convenientes a la tendencia de la epoca en desarrollo, se debe intensificar la investigacion de la rama y dinamizar la lucha por elevar de continuo el nivel tecnico y la calificacion de los productores y por introducir la ciencia y tecnica avanzadas.
					
					Alabando el hecho de que esta fabrica fue acondicionada como un palacio por dentro y un parque por fuera y facilita magnificas condiciones de vida a los obreros al establecer la cultura de trabajo y vida de alto nivel con las instalaciones culturales e higienicas preparadas en lo suficiente, destaco la importancia de seguir prestando profunda atencion a esos quehaceres.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que la clase obrera de la fabrica producira y suministrara mucho mas zapatos de buena calidad a los habitantes al cumplir satisfactoriamente su honroso deber.
					
					Acto seguido, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il vio los articulos producidos en la Cooperativa de Produccion de Articulos de Paja de Sinuiju haciendo conocimiento del estado de administracion y operacion de ella.
					
					Muy satisfecho de que la cooperativa contribuyera a la mejora de la vida del pueblo fabricando utiles y vistosos productos de mimbre de diversos tipos con Cyperus exaltatus, perfolla y materiales locales y derivados agricolas, evaluo altamente los meritos de los miembros de la cooperativa que dedican toda su inteligencia y energia para el pueblo.
					
					Por ultimo, el Dirigente estuvo en la reconstruida y ampliada Planta Avicola de Sinuiju.
					
					Tras escuchar explicaciones ante el plano de la planta, recorrio la sala de mando por computadora, la de incubacion y otros lugares averiguando en detalles el estado de reconstruccion tecnica y produccion.
					
					Muy contento de que los empleados de la fabrica hayan logrado un desarrollo vertiginoso en la produccion de carne y huevos al intensificar la renovacion tecnologica de los procesos productivos conforme a la demanda de la era IT y sentar sobre la base cientifica la cria y el cuidado de pollos, reconocio los esfuerzos de ellos que trabajan dedicando su inteligencia y pasion para el pueblo.
					
					Subrayo que es un exito muy apreciable el hecho de que en los ultimos anos, la planta hiciera gran aporte a la mejora de la vida alimentaria del pueblo al producir mucha cantidad de carne y huevos disminuyendo el costo de produccion mediante la aplicacion activa de la ciencia y tecnica avanzadas.
					
					Agrego que las experiencias de la planta comprueban que sera posible registrar un nuevo viraje tambien en la avicultura cuando se basen en la ciencia y tecnica avanzadas.
					
					Aclarando que la reserva del crecimiento de la produccion en la avicultura esta en la buena variedad, destaco que la planta debe introducir de modo activo buenas variedades, que crezcan rapido y pongan muchos huevos consumiendo poco pienso, al seguir materializando consecuentemente la orientacion del partido de registrar una innovacion en la busqueda de buenas variedades.
					
					Dijo que a fin de normalizar en alto nivel la produccion de la planta, es preciso prestar primordial atencion a la solucion del problema de pienso y recalco que se debe elevar decisivamente el rendimiento de cereales de los campos productores de pienso al aumentar la produccion de abono compuesto organico con el excremento de aves.
					
					Expreso esperanza y conviccion de que los obreros de la planta seguiran registrando de continuo el auge productivo haciendo uso de su espiritu popular y contribuiran mucho a la mejora de la vida alimentaria del pueblo.
					
					Los exitos milagrosos, que se alcanzan a cada momento y a cada hora en la provincia de Phyong-an del Norte agitada por las creaciones y meritos, reflejan directamente la gigantesca figura de nuestra patria que avanza como torrente hacia la cima de la gran potencia prospera, subrayo.
					
					Agrego que tal velocidad de avance es el gran resultado de la indoblegable voluntad e inagotable potencia espiritual del pueblo coreano que marcha adelante a pasos firmes siguiendo siempre al partido sin vacilacion ninguna ante cualesquier pruebas.
					
					Le acompanaron el secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, Kim Phyong Hae, el secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, y los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Nam Gi y Jang Song Thaek.

articles.title: Conversan en Pyongyang titulares de defensa de Corea y China
articles.content:
Conversan en Pyongyang titulares de defensa de Corea y China
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 24 en esta capital las conversaciones entre el vicemariscal del Ejercito Popular de Corea Kim Yong Chun, vicepresidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, y el coronel general Liang Guanglie, consejero de Estado y ministro de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular China.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el viceministro de las FAP Pak Jae Gyong, el coronel general del EPC Sim Sang Dae, el teniente general del EPC Kim Su Hak y otros generales y oficiales del EPC y por la china, el coronel general Huang Xianzhong, comisario politico de la Zona Militar de Shenyang del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh), el teniente general Feng Zhaoju, subcomandante de la Zona Militar de Jinan, el vicealmirante Xu Hongmeng, subcomandante de la Zona Militar de Nanjing y comandante de la Flota del Mar Oriental de la Fuerza Naval, el teniente general de la Fuerza Aerea Jiang Jianzeng, subcomandante de la Zona Militar de Nanjing y comandante de la Fuerza Aerea de la misma zona, el mayor general Chai Shaoliang, jefe de organizacion del Departamento Politico General del EPLCh, el mayor general Wang Jin, subdirector del Departamento de Operacion del Estado Mayor General, el mayor general Jia Xiaoning, subdirector de la Oficina
					
					de los Asuntos Exteriores del Ministerio de Defensa Nacional, y otros acompanantes, el embajador Liu Xiaoming y el agregado militar Sun Yanfeng de la embajada china en Corea.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron sus criterios profundos acerca del desarrollo invariable de las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los ejercitos de los dos paises y otros problemas de interes mutuo.
					
					Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Amistad China-Corea sera eterna, destaca Liang Guanglie
articles.content:
Amistad China-Corea sera eterna, destaca Liang Guanglie
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- En una rueda de prensa ofrecida el dia 24 en esta capital, el coronel general Liang Guanglie, consejero de Estado y ministro de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular China, de visita en Corea, subrayo que sera eterna la amistad China-Corea forjada con sangre.
					A traves de esta visita a Corea, conoci mejor del espiritu revolucionario de autoconfianza y lucha tenaz manifestado por el pueblo coreano en la construccion socialista bajo la direccion del respetado Presidente Kim Il Sung y el gran camarada         Kim Jong Il, dijo el y continuo:
					
					Es el deseo comun de los pueblos de dos paises consolidar y desarrollar de generacion en generacion la tradicional amistad China-Corea preparada por los dirigentes de veterana generacion.
					
					Durante nuestra estancia, hemos sentido el profundo sentimiento de amistad que tiene el pueblo coreano hacia el chino.
					
					Bajo la profunda atencion de los dirigentes de dos paises, las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion China-Corea se fortalecen y se desarrollan incesantemente.
					
					En representacion del pueblo y ejercito chinos, envio cordial saludo y votos al pueblo y ejercito coreanos.
					
					Nos esforzaremos activamente junto con los camaradas coreanos por el hermoso futuro de dos paises y por la paz y estabilidad de la region y el resto del mundo.

articles.title: Se ofrece banquete en honor de Serguei Mijailovich Mironov
articles.content:
Se ofrece banquete en honor de Serguei Mijailovich Mironov
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- La Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 24 en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae un banquete en honor del presidente del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia, de visita en Corea.
					A la recepcion fueron invitados el presidente del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia, Serguei Mijailovich Mironov, el embajador ruso en Corea, Valery Sukhinin, el vicecanciller Alexei Borodavkin, el director del Secretariado del Consejo de Federacion, Ruslan Tatarinov, el director del Buro de Relaciones Internacionales de dicho consejo, Andrei Baklanov, el asesor del presidente del Consejo, Konstantin Pulikovski y otros acompanantes, asi como los miembros de la embajada rusa.
					
					Ademas estuvieron presentes el presidente y el vicepresidente de la APS de la RPDC, Choe Thae Bok y Kim Wan Su, el vicecanciller Kung Sok Ung, el diputado a la APS y presidente del Grupo de Parlamentarios de Amistad Corea-Rusia, Hong So Hon, la diputada a la APS Kim Song Hui y otros funcionarios.
					
					Choe Thae Bok, al hacer uso de la palabra, senalo que la visita del huesped ruso contribuira al ensanche y al desarrollo no solo de las relaciones interparlamentarias de dos paises sino tambien de los vinculos generales entre Corea y Rusia.
					
					Expreso su seguridad de que se consolidaran y se desarrollaran aun mas las relaciones entre los dos paises a base de los espiritus de las declaraciones conjuntas acordadas en el maximo nivel de dos paises y del nuevo tratado interestatal.
					
					Le siguio en usar la palabra Serguei quien subrayo que las relaciones de amistad entre Rusia y Corea tienen profundas raices historicas y destaco que las intimas relaciones entre los pueblos de ambos paises haran gran aporte a la preservacion de la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y el Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					Afirmando que la cooperacion entre los parlamentos de dos paises contribuye ahora al desarrollo de las relaciones Rusia-Corea, concluyo expresando la voluntad de actuar en conjunto en funcion de los intereses de los pueblos.

articles.title: Serguei Mironov deposita ofrenda floral ante monumento a la liberacion
articles.content:
Serguei Mironov deposita ofrenda floral ante monumento a la liberacion 
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El presidente del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia, Serguei Mijailovich Mironov, deposito el dia 25 una ofrenda floral ante el Monumento a la Liberacion.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes los acompanantes del presidente de dicho consejo, el embajador ruso en Corea y otros miembros de esta sede diplomatica y funcionarios correspondientes. 
					
					Fue depositada la ofrenda floral a nombre de Serguei Mironov y su comitiva ante el Monumento a la Liberacion.
					
					Los participantes guardaron un momento de silencio en memoria de los martires del ejercito sovietico y recorrieron el monumento.

articles.title: Vocero de CCPAP denuncia a las autoridades surcoreanas
articles.content:
Vocero de CCPAP denuncia a las autoridades surcoreanas
Pyongyang, 25 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El vocero del Comite Coreano por la Paz de Asia y el Pacifico (CCPAP) publico el dia 25 una declaracion en relacion con que se cumplira pronto un ano y 5 meses desde la suspension del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					Entre tanto, actuamos con toda sinceridad y nos esforzamos en todo lo posible por reiniciar el turismo al monte Kumgang a fin de satisfacer el deseo de los habitantes surcoreanos de ver este monte famoso de nuestra nacion, comienza la nota y prosigue:
					
					Sin embargo, las autoridades surcoreanas reaccionan con una postura muy grosera lejos de reciprocar nuestra buena fe y magnanimidad.
					
					Al imputar a nuestra parte la responsabilidad por la suspension del turismo al monte Kumgang, las autoridades surcoreanos, incluyendo el "Ministerio de Reunificacion", insisten en que no pueden reanudarlo sin que se logre el compromiso de las "3 condiciones" presentadas por si mismas, o sea, la averiguacion de la verdad del "incidente de la turista", la prevencion de repeticion de tales casos, la garantia de seguridad personal.
					
					Ademas, vituperan sin vacilacion alguna que no pueden reconocer el "acuerdo firmado con una empresaria privada".
					
					Al exigir la supuesta "disculpa" por el "incidente de la turista", ellas dicen abiertamente que aun despues de que fueran solucionadas las referidas "3 condiciones", no habra el turismo mediante el pago en efectivo y podrian reiniciar el turismo al monte Kumgang y a Kaesong a condicion de que se garantice la transparencia de los costos del turismo.
					
					Es realmente espantoso que la maxima autoridad surcoreana se haya unido a tal campana intrigante en pro de la confrontacion.
					
					Lo susodicho es cinica sofisteria que parte de la logica de bandido y un insulto y burla a la sinceridad y esfuerzos de nuestra parte.
					
					La parte surcoreana es quien se beneficia realmente del turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					Lo comprueba el hecho de que despues del cese del turismo al monte Kumgang, la Firma Hyundai y Asan llego a punto de bancarrota y se ven duramente golpeadas decenas de empresas relacionadas y la vida de los habitantes de la provincia de Kangwon del Sur de Corea.
					
					Los hechos demuestran patentemente la verdadera intencion del "Ministerio de Reunificacion" y otras autoridades surcoreanas de no reiniciar el turismo al monte Kumgang.
					
					Ademas, ponen en claro que ellas tienen la siniestra intencion de emprender la senda de confrontacion fratricida sumandose activamente a la campana de "sancion" de EE.UU. sin hacer caso de las relaciones intercoreanas ni de la situacion de las empresas y la vida de los habitantes surcoreanos.
					
					A traves de ese problema, las actuales autoridades surcoreanas revelaron por si solas su fachada de perturbadoras de reconciliacion y cooperacion y connotados elementos que persiguen la confrontacion fratricida.
					
					Mientras que obren en el "Ministerio de Reunificacion" los elementos anti-reunificacion tales como Hyon In Thaek, no sera reanudado sin problemas el turismo ni mejoradas las relaciones intercoreanas.
					
					Son nunca perdonables las maniobras del "Ministerio de Reunificacion", que malemplea hasta las nobles gestiones turisticas en la campana de confrontacion fratricida, y toda la nacion coreana no dejara intactos a Hyon y a esa entidad.
					
					El "Ministerio de Reunificacion" y las autoridades conservadoras del Sur de Corea deben parar ahora mismo sus acciones ridiculas al justipreciar la corriente de la epoca actual.
